intro: Ligularia dentata subsp. dentata, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowhead, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with serrated edges, which are typically 10–20 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers in late summer, which are borne on slender, leafless stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found along stream banks and in wet meadows. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water gardens and bog landscapes.
